intro: Heliophila macowaniana, commonly known as the yellow heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is often found in mountainous regions and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking shade-tolerant, flowering plants.
